intro: Lapeirousia oligantha, commonly known as the Cape goldcup, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllis family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in open, sunny habitats. It produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. Lapeirousia oligantha is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to Mediterranean climates.
